io.github.goodees.ese.core.dispatch

Class DispatchingEventSourcingRuntime<E extends EventSourcedEntity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.goodees.ese.core.EventSourcingRuntimeBase<E>
      • io.github.goodees.ese.core.dispatch.DispatchingEventSourcingRuntime<E>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsyncEventSourcingRuntime, SyncEventSourcingRuntime

    public abstract class DispatchingEventSourcingRuntime<E extends EventSourcedEntity>
extends EventSourcingRuntimeBase<E>
    Common base for runtimes that dispatch requests using Dispatcher. In addition to basic execute method, dispatching runtimes support retries of requests, timeouts and scheduled request dispatching.

    • Method Detail

      • getExecutorService

        protected abstract ExecutorService getExecutorService()
        ExecutorService, that will handle entity invocations. Should usually be backed by multiple threads, or can use Java EE 7 Concurrency Utilities' managed resources from application server.
        Returns:
        instance of executor service

      • getScheduler

        protected abstract ScheduledExecutorService getScheduler()
        ScheduledExecutorService, that will handle delayed delivery and timeouts of the requests. Must not use same thread pool like getExecutorService(), because in case that pool is overflowing, the timeouts would not get executed
        Returns:
        instance of ScheduledExecutorService

      • getEntityName

        protected abstract String getEntityName()
        The abstract name for the entities the runtime is servicing. Used for better log messages, and log destinations.
        Returns:
        short name describing the entities

      • invokeEntity

        protected abstract <RS,R extends Request<RS>> void invokeEntity(E entity,
                                                                R request,
                                                                java.util.function.BiConsumer<RS,Throwable> callback)
                                                         throws Exception
        Pass the request to the entity. When the call completes, callback should be invoked with either the result value, or the thrown exception.
        Type Parameters:
        RS - type of response
        R - type of request
        Parameters:
        entity - entity instance
        request - the request to pass
        callback - callback to return the control back to the runtime for the post invocation tasks
        Throws:
        Exception - when anything goes wrong in invocation at level of runtime. Any exception from the entity should be reported via second parameter of the callback

      • retryDelay

        protected long retryDelay(String id,
                          Request<?> request,
                          Throwable error,
                          int attempts)
        Specify whether and when the request should be retried in case of failure. Should return redelivery delay in milliseconds. Returning 0 means to retry immediately, returning less than 0 means not to retry.

        If retry is greater than zero, the runtime may execute other requests before the wait period expires

        Parameters:
        id - identity of the entity
        request - request that failed
        error - the throwable the request failed with
        attempts - number of attempts for execution of that request. Greater than 1.
        Returns:
        negative for failing the request, zero for immediate retry, positive for delay in ms until next attempt
        See Also:
        for exactly the same information

      • execute

        public <R extends Request<RS>,RS> CompletableFuture<RS> execute(String id,
                                                                R request)
        Description copied from class: EventSourcingRuntimeBase
        Execute a request and return future result. This is the entry point for passing request to the entity and getting results from it.

        The runtime guarantees, that for given entityId, there is only one entity instance in the memory and it will only execute single request at time.

        When request is due for invocation, the runtime will perform following steps:

        1. Obtain an up-to-date instance, as described by EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle
        2. Pass the request to the instance. Subclasses of runtime define the contract between runtime and entity
        3. When call completes, EntityInvocationHandler.handleCompletion(String, EventSourcedEntity, Throwable) executes following logic:
          1. Entities invocation state will reflect successful or unsuccessful completion
          2. Method EventSourcedEntity.performPostInvocationActions(List, Throwable) is called to handle post invocation side effects}
          3. If the call completes exceptionally:
            1. When it was due to exception from storage processing, the entity will be removed from cache, so it would be recovered into fresh state on next request
            2. A runtime can optionally choose to retry the request, e. g. like implemented in DispatchingEventSourcingRuntime
            3. The returned future completes exceptionally
            Otherwise, the future completes successfully with the value returned by entity
          4. if runtime decides it should store snapshot of entity state, and entity provides a snapshot, it will be stored.

        We are returning completable future, so that it is easy to either chain the calls, or synchronously wait. However the clients should not call any mutation methods of the CompletableFuture, such as CompletableFuture.complete(Object). They may, and in current implementations will, throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        execute in class EventSourcingRuntimeBase<E extends EventSourcedEntity>
        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of request
        RS - Response type matching to the request
        Parameters:
        id - the identity of the entity to be called
        request - the request to perform
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture of the result.
        See Also:
        EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle

      • executeWithTimeout

        public <R extends Request<RS>,RS> CompletableFuture<RS> executeWithTimeout(String id,
                                                                           R request,
                                                                           long timeout,
                                                                           TimeUnit unit)
        Execute the request with given timeout. If the request has not yet executed until timeout expires, it will finish with CancellationException.

        The runtime cannot guarantee, that currently executed request will be interrupted in any way, so timeouts will not resolve thread starvation in case of some blocking I/O.

        Type Parameters:
        R - type of request
        RS - type of response
        Parameters:
        id - identity of an entity
        request - request to execute
        timeout - timeout for completion
        unit - unit of timeout
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture of the response. May complete with CancellationException if the requests time out
        See Also:
        for general contract of execute method

      • executeLater

        public <R extends Request<RS>,RS> CompletableFuture<RS> executeLater(String id,
                                                                     R request,
                                                                     long delay,
                                                                     TimeUnit unit)
        Execute the request after specified delay. When the delay timer expires, the request would be put in the queue. Will be usually used by entities themselves to trigger some timed task as a reaction to other request.
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of request
        RS - type of response
        Parameters:
        id - identity of an entity
        request - request to execute
        delay - amount of wait before request delivery
        unit - unit of delay
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture of the response
        See Also:
        Gneral contract of execute method

      • executeLaterWithTimeout

        public <R extends Request<RS>,RS> CompletableFuture<RS> executeLaterWithTimeout(String id,
                                                                                R request,
                                                                                long delay,
                                                                                TimeUnit dUnit,
                                                                                long timeout,
                                                                                TimeUnit tUnit)
        Execute the request after specified delay, but requiring it to complete within given timeout. The timeout starts from the moment this method finishes, therefore timeout must be greater than the delay.
        Type Parameters:
        R - request type
        RS - response type*
        Parameters:
        id - the identity of the entity
        request - the request to execute
        delay - amount of wait before request delivery
        dUnit - unit of delay
        timeout - timeout for completion
        tUnit - unit of timeout
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture of the response. May complete with CancellationException if the requests time out

      • getDispatcher

        protected Dispatcher getDispatcher()
        Lazily initialized Dispatcher to use for the callbacks.
        Returns:
        the dispatcher of the runtime

      • createDispatcher

        protected Dispatcher createDispatcher()
        Create dispatcher before first use.
        Returns:
        dispatcher instance
        See Also:
        Default configuration of the dispatcher

      • getDispatcherConfiguration

        protected DispatcherConfiguration getDispatcherConfiguration()
        Configuration of the dispatcher. Default implementation delegates to methods of this class:
        • executor service is determined by getExecutorService()
        • scheduler service is determined by getScheduler()
        • dispatcher name is determined by getEntityName()
        • retry delay is determined by retryDelay(String, Request, Throwable, int)
        Actual execution flow is following:
        1. Entity instance is obtained via EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle
        2. Request is invoked by passing control to invokeEntity(EventSourcedEntity, Request, BiConsumer)
        3. The passed callback with call EntityInvocationHandler.handleCompletion(String, EventSourcedEntity, Throwable) and then pass control back to dispatcher
        If any exception happens during these steps, there response completes exceptionally with that exception.
        Returns:
        the dispatcher configuration.
